name: Errol Flynn Movies Quiz | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: In "Captain Blood", Flynn endears himself to the king by helping to ease the governor's ailment. What ailment is that?
questions.explanation:
Gout.

	An early starring role for Flynn - and a fine swashbuckling movie with Flynn as doctor-turned pirate. Early teaming with Olivia DeHavilland.

questions.text: Flynn often appeared with Alan Hale (Senior) and Guinn ("Big Boy")Williams in his movies. Which of them appeared in "The Adventures of Robin Hood"?
questions.explanation:
Hale.

	Hale played Little John, but Williams didn't make it into this one. A great adventure classic.

questions.text: Flynn usually got the girl, but his character didn't win out in "The Charge of the Light Brigade". Who did?
questions.explanation:
Flynn's brother.

	Thus, Flynn was able to die heroically in the valiant charge without leaving behind any "loose ends".

questions.text: In "The Santa Fe Trail", Flynn's nemesis in the movie was...?
questions.explanation:
John Brown.

	Set in the days before the civil war, abolitionist John Brown (as played by fine actor Raymond Massey) is stirring things up. Good western.

questions.text: In "The Sea Hawk", Flynn was not teamed with frequent leading lady Olivia de Havilland. Who was his co-star?
questions.explanation:
Brenda Marshall.

	It just doesn't seem the same without Olivia there. Not his best, but not bad.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a Flynn western?
questions.explanation:
Abilene.

	Flynn made several westerns; these are three of them. (No "Abilene".)

questions.text: In "They Died With Their Boots On", who does Flynn play?
questions.explanation:
George Armstrong Custer.

	Flynn played George Custer - from West Point to Little Big Horn.

questions.text: Which of these WW II movies starred Flynn?
questions.explanation:
Objective, Burma.

	"Burma" is one of a few WW II movies that Flynn made. "Wake" starred Brian Donlevy, "Anzio" starred Robert Mitchum, "Marauders" starred Jeff Chandler.

Jim Corbett.

	The movie was "Gentleman Jim" (as Corbett was known); Flynn played the title role.

questions.text: Flynn starred in "The Master of Ballantrae". The movie was based on a novel by what author?
questions.explanation:
Robert Louis Stevenson.

	Flynn starred in other movies that were based on famous novels, such as Kim" (Kipling) and "The Prince and The Pauper" (Twain).
